identificationModule.briefTitle: Seroquel XR in Adults With Schizophrenia
identificationModule.officialTitle: Open-label Multicentre Study on Efficacy and Safety of Oral Quetiapine (Seroquel XR) in Adults With Schizophrenia

statusModule.whyStopped: The study was prematurely terminated due to insufficient recruitment.

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of Seroquel XR in schizophrenia patients with acute worsening symptoms. Consequently, to assess whether the study drug is safe and acceptable on the daily dose basis, orally given, up to 600 mg once a day for 42 days.

interventions.name: Quetiapine fumarate (Seroquel)
interventions.description: 600mg Extended release tablet, oral, once daily

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Total Score
primaryOutcomes.description:
Change in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale Total Score from Day 1 (baseline) to Day 42 (final visit) or withdrawal. Minimum value of total PANSS is 30 , Maximum is 210.

Minimum value considered better is score decreased from baseline at least 30%.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Clinical Global Impression - Severity of Illness (CGI-S) Score
secondaryOutcomes.description: Clinical Global Impression - Severity of Illness. Maximum possible value is 7 (worst outcome), the minimum is 1 (best outcome). Values are considered better outcome: decrease from baseline \> 1 score.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Clinical Global Impression - Severity of Illness (CGI-S) Score
secondaryOutcomes.description: Clinical Global Impression - Severity of Illness. Maximum possible value is 7 (worst outcome), the minimum is 1 (best outcome). Values are considered better outcome: decrease from baseline \> 1 score.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patient meets the DSM-IV criteria for schizophrenia
* Patient has a PANSS total score ≥ 70 at baseline
* Patient has a CGI-S score of ≥ 4(moderately ill) at baseline
* Patient is healthy on the basis of physical examination and vital signs at baseline

Exclusion Criteria:

* Positive urine drug screen for Opiates, amphetamine, barbiturate, cocaine, cannabis, or ecstasy abuse
* Has history of neuroleptic malignant syndrome, seropositive for anti-HIV, hepatitis B or C virus antigen
* Patient with unstable or inadequately treated Diabetes Mellitus
* Use of potent cytochrome P450 inhibitors or inducer within 14 days before baseline

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: On Day 1, baseline assessments will be performed, and patients will be assigned to Seroquel XR at 300 mg. On Day 2 all patients are assigned to reach target dose of Seroquel XR at 600 mg. Administration of study medication continue with Seroquel XR 600 mg daily until Day 42. Each visit will have ± 3 days window period.
participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: Patients provide informed consent and are screened for eligibility (at Visit 1) up to 7 days before baseline assessment on Day 1.

groups.title: Seroquel XR
groups.description: Seroquel XR 300mg on day 1, 600mg from day 2 onwards. The treatment period will take 6 weeks or 42 days.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Clinical Global Impression - Severity of Illness (CGI-S) Score
outcomeMeasures.description: Clinical Global Impression - Severity of Illness. Maximum possible value is 7 (worst outcome), the minimum is 1 (best outcome). Values are considered better outcome: decrease from baseline \> 1 score.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: The number of patient at Day 42 (n= 17) is different than at Baseline (n= 28), because some of them withdraw/terminate during the study.
